data.title: Cheryl reveals plans to change her name AGAIN
data.meta_description: She may have already been a Tweedy, Cole and Fenandez-Versini, but...
data.text:
She's currently known as 'Cheryl'

She may have already been a Tweedy, Cole and Fenandez-Versini, but Cheryl isn't stopping with just three name changes.

After the star ended things with Ashley Cole, she famously kept his last name, but things weren't so easy with second husband Jean-Bernard Fernandez-Versini. The former Girls Aloud singer decided to drop the double barrel surname all together.

And who needs a surname when you're as famous as Cheryl, right? She's only following in the footsteps of music legends such as Madonna, Beyoncé and Rihanna.

But not content with just being known as Cheryl, the mum-of-one has revealed plans she's making a u-turn.

"Fans call me Chez, I love it.", the 35-year-old told The Metro.

"Let’s stick with that. These days you can call yourself whatever you want. Why can’t I be Chezza?"

"I know I have had 20 other names! But you can evolve. I’m changing again… triple barrel!"

Check out Cheryl's full relationship timeline with Liam Payne:

It comes after Cheryl opened up about her split with One Direction singer Liam Payne earlier this week.

Speaking to Mail Online, Cheryl said, "I hate the lows... I hate the lows. It's kind of one of the things that makes us not want to get into a relationship. Nothing quite makes you feel like that, does it? Nothing else."

However, despite a number of rumours saying the pair's relationship is now frosty, Cheryl revealed things are all good.

She told the publication, "There's no animosity whatsoever. We are learning all the time. And it's good, it's healthy."

Cheryl continues her role on new BBC show The Greatest Dancer.

Find out everything you need to know about The Greatest Dancer right here.
